newsitem.title: UK: Hanson mulls $665 mln Grove Worldwide sale - paper.
newsitem.headline: Hanson mulls $665 mln Grove Worldwide sale - paper.

text.p: British-based materials and services group Hanson Plc is considering whether to sell its Grove Worldwide subsidiary, the world's leading hydraulic-crane manufacturer, for around 400 million pounds ($665 million), the Sunday Times newspaper said.
It said U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs had been called in to conduct an international auction of the business after a number of informal approaches by trade buyers.
The newspaper quoted unnamed experts as saying the crane sector was extremely competitive and profits were low, but did not say when any sale might take place.
"Once the Grove sale is completed, Hanson is expected to return to expansion through a mixture of organic growth and acquisition," the Sunday Times said.
It was not immediately possible to contact Hanson for comment.
